title: [Large-Scale] Data-Driven Decision-Making and Simulation Modeling Workshop for Sports Coaching Policy Development: Statistical and Probability Modeling Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of education policy, basic principles of sports coaching, leadership theories, basic statistical analysis (mean/variance/standard deviation/confidence intervals), understanding of data visualization, and foundational concepts of probability distributions
context.additional_context: Teachers/pre-service teachers experience sports coaching policy development using VR simulation data in smartphone-limited environments, proposing practical implementation plans through project-based assessments. Verifies policy effectiveness via statistical analyses (normal/binomial distribution, scatterplots/histograms).

learning_goals: Learners analyze performance data of sports organizations to identify cultural change patterns and establish policy development strategies using statistical inference (regression analysis/hypothesis testing)

Learners collect and analyze stakeholder interaction data during VR simulation-based coaching policy implementation, and can write a report explaining prediction results based on probabilistic models (Bayesian networks/Monte Carlo simulations) with 80% accuracy

Learners design and evaluate sports education policy optimization models (linear/nonlinear programming) using real sports data (e.g., athlete training records, game results) through small-scale team projects

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
